zeejfps.engine.core

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • zeejfps.engine.core.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SnakeGame

    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for running the game loop as well as containing all necessary variables and objects that are used to interact with the game.
    Author:
    Zeejfps

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(int width, int height, int scale)
      Creates a game with a screen of given width and height and a buffer scaled down by the scale.

      void exit()
      This method will set running flag to false and then waits until the game thread has completed running, then calls the onStop method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int width,
    int height,
    int scale)
        Creates a game with a screen of given width and height and a buffer scaled down by the scale.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the screen in pixels.
        height - the height of the screen in pixels.
        scale - the amount you want the image to be scaled down by, higher = better performance.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public final void run()
        This method is the entry point of the game. When called the game thread is started and the game loop begins to run, onStart method is then called.

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Called when the game is started. This is where you want to do all of your creating logic or anything you want right before the main loop is started.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        Called over and over in game loop at specified max ups. Do all of your game logic in this method.

      • render

        public abstract void render(double interp)
        Called over and over in game loop at specified max fps, however, the updates are prioritized. Do your rendering logic in here.
        Parameters:
        interp - how far between updates this is called.

      • onExit

        public abstract void onExit()
        Called when the game is stopped. Do all of your clean up logic in here.

      • exit

        public final void exit()
        This method will set running flag to false and then waits until the game thread has completed running, then calls the onStop method.

      • setDebugLevel

        public void setDebugLevel(java.util.logging.Level level)
        This method sets the level of debug that will be printed in the console.
        Parameters:
        level - the highest level of debug you want printed in console.

      • setMaxFps

        public void setMaxFps(int maxFps)
        This method sets the preferred max frames per second.
        Parameters:
        maxFps - preferred frames per second.

      • setMaxUps

        public void setMaxUps(int maxUps)
        This method sets the preferred max updates per second.
        Parameters:
        maxUps - preferred updates per second.

      • getScreen

        public Screen getScreen()
        Returns:
        the game screen object.

      • getKeyboard

        public Keyboard getKeyboard()
        Returns:
        the keyboard object.

      • getMouse

        public Mouse getMouse()
        Returns:
        the mouse object.

      • getRenderer

        public Renderer getRenderer()
        Returns:
        the renderer.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns:
        true if the game's running flag is set to true.
